newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dlr ends lower on foreign fund outflow.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dlr ends lower on foreign fund outflow.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar closed slightly lower against its U.S. counterpart on Tuesday, reflecting mild foreign fund outflow. Dealers nonetheless expected a stable trend ahead.
The local unit fluctuated within a narrow range and finished at T$27.543 against Monday's T$27.538 close.
Turnover through dealers was a modest US$199 million.
"Some investors decided to take profits on the local currency's recent rebound, but otherwise trading was pretty even," said one dealer at a foreign bank.
He expected the rate to maintain a steady level in the near term.
"I don't see dramatic factors swinging the rate either way," he said.
A T$27.52-55 range was seen for Wednesday.
